title: How is Fiora a challenge for Jax?
body:
I'm sure Jax has met the odd mortal who gets a slight upper hand to him across the millennia, but I doubt any have actually beaten him.

Jax survived the fall of his ancient city, he survived the *literal* void. 

Jax has probably travelled across presumably all of Runeterra, finding warriors and observing countless strategies.

He probably isn't even Human, and whatever he is he is observed as a "giant"

He _*BEHEADED AN ASCENDED GOD WARRIOR*_

His abilities imply he has some form of magic, but his abilities weren't created with his modern lore in mind. 

How is Fiora a challenge for Jax?

I'm sure she is a great fighter, but c'mon....

replies.body:
First off, Fiora isn't just a great fighter, shes a one in a million, a prodigy. She beat her father, a presumably very skilled fighter at very young age(likely about 16), and even if she wouldn't have won, was going to fight the Champion of House Crownguard(likely Garen), so that shows her determination, which is something Jax also has. Skill wise she has trained her entire life to fight, Shes lost track of the people shes killed, which were all warriors or nobles(who are trained in swordplay). In her story fight she kills her opponent in under a second. 

Think about it, the characters in league are all falling into one intertwined story that will shape the future of Runeterra, if Fiora wasn't standout amazing, more so than a great fighter, why would they even bother mentioning her? 

>He probably isn't even Human, and whatever he is he is observed as a "giant"

Jax is likely a human, just a big dude, like Darius or Garen. The pre transformation description of Jax is given from another soldiers point of view. If you were a new recruit in Darius' regiment and you saw him, you would describe him as a giant. He tall, hes incredibly stocky, his bicep is bigger than most torsos, but hes still human. A new soldier, someone unfamiliar with him would describe him as a giant, its the same for Jax. 

>He BEHEADED AN ASCENDED GOD WARRIOR

When Jax decapitated the ascended, he didn't do it alone in one on one combat, he had his group of elite soldiers with him, they even say "We had to topple half the mountain to put the big bastard down,” Colgrim added. “And even then, only Saijax had a weapon big enough to take its head off.” Now that sounds like the entire unit had to do it, not just Jax.

>His abilities imply he has some form of magic, but his abilities weren't created with his modern lore in mind.

They say he wields the "last light of icathia" which is presumably where the magic he gets is from. But even if he has that, Fiora has Demacian steel armor which is, as Riot has made clear, impervious to magic, so that doesn't matter. 

>Jax has probably travelled across presumably all of Runeterra, finding warriors and observing countless strategies.

Fiora is also incredibly smart, its in the first few lines of her lore, Jax isn't the only one to know multiple strategies.


If her abilities are translated into story, she can easily and quickly identify where her opponent is currently most open and exposed, and her strikes are precise enough to penetrate/avoid any protection they have on. She is nimble and quick, able to easily reposition around her opponent while striking quickly and precisely. While probably most importantly she also has a strong defense, able to avoid/counter any strike be it through parrying it or simply moving out of the way. 

Fiora is a challenge for Jax because he hasn't fought anyone like her, he may have fought strong opponents, but not one that was as skilled as her. If she wasn't noteworthy she wouldn't be in the story of Ruenterra.

She is nimble and quick, able to easily reposition around her opponent while striking quickly and precisely. While probably most importantly she also has a strong defense, able to avoid/counter any strike be it through parrying it or simply moving out of the way.

I'm not saying Fiora isn't skilled lol, but I doubt she would be a challenge for Jax

> [{quoted}](name=Speak or Die,realm=OCE,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=pIjkqAXO,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2018-10-16T14:59:40.382+0000)
>
> I'm not saying Fiora isn't skilled lol, but I doubt she would be a challenge for Jax

Jax is still mortal to our knowledge, and even though he's skilled at every weapon, that doesn't mean he's the best in the entire world with every weapon. He's still capable of slipping up, getting distracted, being outwitted, taking a hit that will weaken him, etc. He's extremely good, but he's not perfect. No one is perfect.
He was transformed by the void.

> [{quoted}](name= Irrompible,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=pIjkqAXO,comment-id=0002000000000000,timestamp=2018-10-16T18:13:41.260+0000)
>
> He was transformed by the void.

So? That doesn't make you perfect. Jax is still capable of error and being outwitted and outmaneuvered.
It seems i replied to the wrong post, this was meant for the guy saying "hes not human he has 3 fingers" my bad.

> [{quoted}](name=Scathlocke,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=pIjkqAXO,comment-id=0002000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-10-18T02:19:57.647+0000)
>
>
> (The Void is not an upgrade...)

Interesting.

So how would you explain {{champion:38}} 's powers?

They certainly seem like they are an upgrade, albeit Kassadin's skin complexion does seem a bit blue nowadays.

If the new story is anything to go by, Kassadin doesn't seem to hear the whispers of the Void, nor has his physical capabilities gotten worse.

So how is the Void not an upgrade in this case?

I'd *love* to hear your thoughts on this.

In my non-Riot opinion, Kassadin's contraptions and weapon have made him able to use the Void, but it's still destroying him. His body has changed and deterioration is inevitable. In the story he states

>In my other hand, I clutch the stone tightly. Its foreign magic has kept me alive this long—long enough to delve far, far beneath the wastelands of old Icathia. It holds your corruption at bay, though at what cost to my flesh and my spirit, I cannot guess, for this smallest of trinkets now thrums in time with my own heart. That fearful rhythm is not the pulse of life, or magic, or any other wholesome thing, but of oblivion itself.

He's wasting away in one way or another. Something like Riftwalk is probably incredibly draining on his psyche and energy, since he enters the actual Void I believe. Notice he doesn't do it in the story at all. I have a feeling that Kassadin won't Riftwalk even a handful of times in what remains of his life.

> [{quoted}](name=rob the blob,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=pIjkqAXO,comment-id=000200000000000000000000000000010000,timestamp=2018-10-18T13:36:48.968+0000)

Notice he doesn't do it in the story at all. I have a feeling that Kassadin won't Riftwalk even a handful of times in what remains of his life.

I mean, it explains why the mana cost increases for every cast - Kassadin requiring more and more energy if he wants to continue to do it.

He has a void stone and a weapon from a God warrior. Two artifacts.

Maybe he has more or those are enough to supplement his abilities.

> [{quoted}](name=Galiö,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=pIjkqAXO,comment-id=000200000000000000000000000000010001,timestamp=2018-10-18T17:14:18.291+0000)
>
> He has a void stone and a weapon from a God warrior. Two artifacts.
> 
> Maybe he has more or those are enough to supplement his abilities.

Regardless of it being through artifacts or not, he's still wielding the power of the Void.

What power of the void exactly? All the void did to him is drive him to madness in a search for purpose and trying to be a hero. He has a void stone, which assists him with his entrance to and fro the void which kills him inside... and outside. 
And a weapon from a God warrior which acts like a spectral blade and I assume does his magic for him.

All the void did for him is drive him crazy unlike kaisa sho goes to and fro the void for long periods of time and was driven to become a supermodel with the scandalous symbiote exposing cleavage almost down to her midriff.
Kai'Sa is being protected from the void by the symbiote, which is far more efficient than Kassadins armor.

> [{quoted}](name=Galiö,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=pIjkqAXO,comment-id=00020000000000000000000000000001000100000000,timestamp=2018-10-18T18:51:55.559+0000)

> All the void did for him is drive him crazy unlike kaisa sho goes to and fro the void for long periods of time and was driven to become a supermodel with the scandalous symbiote exposing cleavage almost down to her midriff.

So you're going to tell me, that him shooting balls of purple stuff, making a shield of purple stuff, shooting a cone of purple stuff, and teleporting and then splashing a bunch of purple stuff around him has nothing to do with the Void?

Anyone who has that void stone can do that.
The shooting of purple stuff is his God warrior weapon just like how ezreal teleports and shoots beams because of his God weapon. 
It's his equipment not a mutation.
People are claiming kassadin was changed and has power of the void when in fact he is slowly dying and had an item from The void.

> [{quoted}](name=Galiö,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=pIjkqAXO,comment-id=0002000000000000000000000000000100010000000000000000,timestamp=2018-10-18T22:38:32.206+0000)

I'm not sure what you're trying to say.

So the void worms its way into your head, but does it physically transform you at all other than just, like, erasing you? Looking at malzahar in particular you'd think yes the void can corrupt a person like that, which is I think where a lot of confusion comes from.

people arguing jax is human when dude only has 3 or 4 fingers
like i've said elsewhere, sand troll
Its Ezreal, its a meme, the dudes not a sand troll, he was a human who was transformed by the void.

> [{quoted}](name= Irrompible,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=pIjkqAXO,comment-id=000500000000,timestamp=2018-10-16T21:29:47.638+0000)

Riot has said many times that Jax was not transformed by the void and it may be not human.
Can confirm. We have said these things.

So how does that work, was Icathia non humans? Were they just co existing and it just wasn't mentioned anywhere and people are just expected to know? How does that work? In his description in the lore they just leave out that hes purple, that makes sense.

>

Why are you trying so hard to justify yourself?

Just accept you were wrong.

There hasn't been a single human in existence that hasn't been wrong at some point.

So then what is he a Yordle?

Because less than 5 fingers implies Yordle.

Trundle is not a yordle either.
And there is actually that theory that Jax might be a Sandtroll.
That's such a good theory actually
Remember when Riot chopped the fingers off the entire Yordle race. Savage.
Any half-decent yordle would just imagine himself some new fingers...

She challenges him because she can hit him RIGHT THROUGH THE COUNTERSTRIKE!
Come on, nobody?
Jax can kill aurelian sol with a crayon, fiora would die just looking at him.

> [{quoted}](name=Pika Fox,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=pIjkqAXO,comment-id=000b,timestamp=2018-10-17T14:17:58.867+0000)
>
> Jax can kill aurelian sol with a crayon, fiora would die just looking at him.

upvoted

Which one of Jax's abilities makes you say he has magic? He has:

* an aa-reset
* a leap
* a parry
* a combo of 3 strikes

All of that is strictly physical, martial-artist'y abilities, nothing magical.

Fiora on the other hand has:

* an aa-reset
* a dash
* a parry
* the ability to detect/strike weak points

The parallel between the two is obvious, and Fiora is a credible rival.

> [{quoted}](name=DeathBurs7,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=pIjkqAXO,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2018-10-16T12:30:24.047+0000)
>
> * an aa-reset
> * a combo of 3 strikes
> strictly physical

These deal magic damage though. And his lamp post is somehow just as deadly as blades, poisons, projectiles and spells. He has to be using some sort of enhancement/enchantment.

Keep in mind that ingame the abilities damage is scaled for balance.
Aurelion throwing a mini star at you is usually weaker than Vayne shooting 3 arrows.

> [{quoted}](name=DeathBurs7,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=pIjkqAXO,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2018-10-16T12:30:24.047+0000)

> * a parry
> * the ability to detect/strike weak points
> 
> The parallel between the two is obvious, and Fiora is a credible rival.

I'm pretty sure he is talking lore-wise, while not taking into account their kit...

Just to make it clear, Jax's kit is also very very old compaired to his quite recent lore "rework" which means it isn't reliable at all for this context
He specifically said "His abilities imply he has some form of magic", which is was I'm replying to.
